messages.content: What does the ComfyUI-TextOverlay node do?
The ComfyUI-TextOverlay node allows users to overlay text on images, adjusting parameters such as font size, type, color, alignment, and position.
What was the inspiration for the ComfyUI-TextOverlay node?
The ComfyUI-TextOverlay node was inspired by the Text Overlay Plugin by mikkel.
What are the key features of the ComfyUI-TextOverlay node?
The key features include font customization, color selection, alignment and positioning, stroke customization, and support for single and batch processing.
How do I install the TextOverlay node?
Clone the GitHub repository `Munkyfoot/ComfyUI-TextOverlay` into the `custom_nodes` directory of your ComfyUI installation.
How do I use the TextOverlay node in a workflow?
Add the TextOverlay node to your workflow, connect an image source, configure node parameters, then connect the node's output to a destination.
Can I use a custom font with the TextOverlay node?
Yes, you can use a custom font by including the font file in the `fonts` directory and specifying the file name in the node's `font` parameter.
What input parameters does the TextOverlay node require?

The node requires inputs for the image(s), text content, font size, font, fill color hex code, stroke color hex code, stroke thickness, padding, horizontal alignment, vertical alignment, and x and y shifts.
What output does the TextOverlay node provide?
The node outputs the modified input image(s) with the specified text overlaid according to the configured parameters.
